inclusion.criterion: joint information meeting for women booked for planned CD
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: In any need of further information, the women will be given contact information on key persons responsible for the project.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: All study participants give oral and written consent at the day of the CD, after at least 4 days of consideration in accordance with the Declaration of Helsinki and Central Denmark Research Ethics Committee.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The women are informed that their consent can be withdrawn at any time.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Publication of project results Both positive, negative, and inconclusive results will be published in international peer-reviewed journals and at the website of the Regional Hospital of Randers.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Ethical considerations With this study the investigators hope to evaluate the possible benefits of caesarean delivery without routine placement of an indwelling catheter in order to improve the course for women with a future CD.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The investigators do think that the possible knowledge gained from the project will exceed any possible disadvantages experienced by the individual study participants.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Information on patient compensation The Patient Compensation Association covers the trial.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Elective caesarean section (CD). At least 18 years of age.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: joint information meeting for women booked for planned CD, where verbal and written information about the project will be provided, by a project assistant or a midwife from the delivery ward. Both the assistant and midwife are informed and taught personally by the trial doctor.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: women will have the opportunity for reflection at least 4 days before making any decision.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Antibiotic therapy less than one week before caesarean and ≥ 3 prior CDs.
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has a history of BPH with multiple urological procedures, including suprapubic prostatectomy. He had a severe urethral stricture that required surgical intervention.
